alice.tuprologx.ide

Interface InputField

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaInputField

    interface InputField
    This interface is not public, since it is intended for internal use, and could be subject to several changes in future releases.
    Version:
    1.0 - 14-nov-02
    Author:
    Giulio Piancastelli

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getGoal()
      Get the goal displayed in the input field.
      void setConsole(ConsoleManager console)
      Since the solve() method must be placed in a class implementing the InputField interface, I need a reference to the Console where output, solveInfo, tuProlog engine and the ProcessInput thread are placed.

    • Method Detail

      • setConsole

        void setConsole(ConsoleManager console)
        Since the solve() method must be placed in a class implementing the InputField interface, I need a reference to the Console where output, solveInfo, tuProlog engine and the ProcessInput thread are placed. This behaviour will change as soon as there will be no need of separate input components for .NET and Java2, i.e. as soon as the AltGr bug in Thinlet, preventing the use of italian keycombo AltGr + '?' and AltGr + '+' to write '[' and ']', will be solved.

      • getGoal

        java.lang.String getGoal()
        Get the goal displayed in the input field.
        Returns:
        The goal displayed in the input field.
